alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 9:36PM EST until March 05 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of West Central Ohio, including the following counties, Auglaize, Darke, Mercer and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Streams continue to rise, or may be slow to recede, due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 934 PM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding in numerous locations across the warned area, with several roads still closed due to lingering high water. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Little to no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Sidney, Celina, Wapakoneta, St. Marys, Coldwater, Fort Shawnee, New Bremen, Minster, Versailles, St. Henry, Newport, Cridersville, Union City, Anna, Fort Loramie, Jackson Center, Fort Recovery, Ansonia, Botkins and Rockford.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
